values:
My weekend was pretty eventful.  Yesterday I had to do clinical time for paramedic school at ST Luke West Hospital in their labor and delivery department.  When I got there, their was a woman in labor.  About 2 hours later it was an imminent delivery.  I went in to watch and the Doctor asked me if I wanted to deliver the baby.  I thought to myself, why the hell not.  It's something that I might have to do one day so...I delivered a baby.  It was disgusting and fascinating all at the same time.  There was a lot of fluid flying everywhere for a little bit which was gross, but the baby delivered fine and turned out well.  It was quite and experience.  
Today a few people from work and myself climbed the Crew Tower.  It was for lung health or something like that.  804 steps and 45 floors later MY LUNGS WERE ON FIRE.  Unfortunately they didn't give us our time when we got to the top but I estimate that I finished in about 9 minutes.  It was a fun time.

In paramedic school our class is going through different scenarios to practice advanced life support procedures.  In one of the evolutions there is this super expensive mannequin that basically is like a real person.  This thing can talk, you can take his blood pressure and pulse, his chest will rise and fall with each breath and you can hear breath sounds or lack there of.  It really is quite extensive.  Well if anyone knows anything about me, I am terrified of robots and aliens.  They really just scare the hell out of me.  Well this stupid mannequin really reminds me of a robot because it can talk and move.  I walked into the room and I saw it's chest moving up and down and it was talking...I almost flipped out.  It took everything I had to go near it and then I had to check to see if it had a pulse!  I felt where a pulse would be and there was one.  I was just waiting for it to get off the table and walk out of the room.  I hope I don't have to encounter this thing again.  I hate it.

I'm pretty sure the reason I am thinking like I am is because I am completely fucking bored.  I have too much anxiety right now.  Something needs to be done about this.  
I went tanning today in hopes to become less transparent.  I am now burnt.  Imagine that.

I haven't updated in forever.  I hope to more often in the future.  There has been so much on my mind I feel I need to get stuff out.  I've come to the conclusion that I love my job.  I have seen some interesting stuff lately.  We rolled up on a non-breather.  We get her into the ambulance and when we cut her shirt off and her bra was all black and discolored.  We took that off and where her left breast was, was all rotten out and infected.  It seemed like she didn't ever change her bra and it was growing into her body.  Everytime I put my hand down to do a chest compression it felt like I was going to break through her body.  No one could figure out what it was but we did know whatever it was, it smelled horrible.  One of my partners ended up throwing up in the back of the squad.  I don't know how I didn't.  When we got to the hospital we found out it was untreated breast cancer.  I never thought it would look like that.
Wednesday night found out to be an eventful night.  Around 7 we were called to a 24 y/o male non-breather. Our ambulance is already on the scene along with a million police.  We get there and find out it's a suicide.  This dude hung himself because he got into a fight with his girlfriend.  He was in the basement.  Our crew was already to work on him when we get there.  I saw him and he had a pretty deep indentation on his neck from where the extension cord was and from there up he was bluish purple.  My Captain let me try to intubate him.  It didn't work very well.  That was my first attempt ever and it probably didn't help that his throat was all swollen.  I don't feel too bad though because the paramedic didn't make it either.  
A few weeks ago we get called to an unconscious/unresponsive patient.  We get there and he is laying in the back of a SUV.  His friends say he is haveing a seizure.  We see him and he's not having a seizure, he's postureing which isn't good at all.  That usually means that you have increased intercrainal pressure.  We throw him in the back of the squad and check his blood sugar which could be the reason he's doing this.  That turns out okay.  I notice he's a little cool to the touch but I figured it was just because he was outside in the cold for a little bit.  We do all the other stuff we can do for him and we go to the hospital.  The nurses notice too that he is cool to the touch and they take his temperature.  It was way below normal.  They throw some warm blankets on him and wrap him up.  A few minutes later the dude wakes up!  He was unconscious because he was too cold.  His body just shut down.  I would've never of thought that could happen.
Thursday we also had a structure fire around 2 in the morning.  When we arrived on scene we were greeted by the guy who lives there.  His skin was falling off his arms.  He informed us that he was attempting to put out the fire.  He was badly burned everywhere.  We could see the fire from the window on the second floor in the bi-level house.  I asked him if the front door was open and he said it wasn't.  My partner and I then proceeded to force entry into the door.  We were able to get it halfway open.  Something was preventing it from opening at the bottom.  As soon as we forced half of it the fire blew out of the second story window, we had to get back and mask up.  My lieutenant masked up before us and knocked the rest of the door open.  We found out later that the guy that lives there nailed it shut at the bottom for some unknown reason.  That could've been bad if we didn't force it open at first and someone had to get out of it later if they were trapped or hurt.  The engine company put water on the fire while my parnter and I searched for other victims.  Luckily we didn't find any.  It was a good fire but the crew that I was with didn't preform well at all.  I was on a truck with people that had 30+ years of experience and I was the one who had to carry them around.  I had to tell them what to do...it should've not been like that at all.  It was so bad that one of the people is being written up.  If you can't stand the heat, get out.

Also, I am going to run a marathon in May.  I am quite excited about this.

Just to forewarn everybody, if you have a weak stomach,you might not want to read this.

Basically, last night sucked...a lot.  I was about 6 hours away from finishing up my 36 hour straight shift at Forest Park when I discovered I had food poisoning.  I don't even know how many times I've thrown up today.  I have finally stopped throwing up and my stomach feels much better but now I have acquired a fever of 101 degrees and a splitting headache.  I can't relax and I am dehydrated.  I would not wish any of this on anyone, ever...well maybe a certain few but I won't go into that.  On top of that, I haven't really slept in the past 5 days and this whole epidemic will not let me sleep.  I hope this passes soon because I feel horrible.

I've decided that I really love working at Forest Park Fire Department.  I have learned so many things and seen so many things in the little time that I've been there.  During my 36 hour shift I had my first code.  A code is a cardiac arrest.  The person has no pulse and is not breathing.  I almost had two of them in the past but my Capitan called both of them DOA.  (dead on arrival)  They were dead long enough that there was no way of saving them.  Anyways, we get to this older guy and my Capitan decided that has gone down in a small enough time frame where we can do CPR and try to revive him.  Now usually when someone goes down, they vomit and lose their bowls.  I must definitely say this guy did.  The people that I'm with have me start doing chest compressions.  He definitely had fluid and vomit still in him and every time I did a chest compression, a fountain of fluid and vomit would arise up out of his mouth.  We move this guy to the squad and I start suctioning the fluid out of his mouth so that we can intubate him (stick a tube down his windpipe to his lungs so that he has an adequate airway) and so that fluid won't go into his lungs when we bag him.  (force air into his lungs)  We finally get him intubated but there is some fluid in his lungs.  So again whenever I do a chest compression, fluid is coming up through this tube.  It almost hit me a few times.  Luckily it stopped.  The paramedics get an IV into him and start pushing all of these drugs into him to try and get his heart to restart.  When we get to the hospital the doctor calls it.  He's dead.  It really wasn't as upsetting to me as I thought it would be.  I realize that most everyone you get to when they code are already dead.  I'm pretty sure that was the case when we got to that guy.  If I dwell on all the deaths that I've seen then I wouldn't be able to function.  So I am going to try my best not too.  The thing that sucked the most though was that this guy smelled...and I still smell his smell.  It almost makes me sick.  Hopefully it goes away.  
I think it's going to be very hard to deal with deaths when someone close to me dies.  I really haven't had anyone I know die.  My grandparents live in Forest Park.  I just really hope that I don't have to see them die.  It definitely was a learning experience.  The people I was with said I did an awesome job at what I had to do.  That made me feel good.  Next week we have car extrication class.  I'm excited about this.

I feel like I've fucked over and let down a lot of people in the past.  I don't really like that feeling.  I think a lot of this has to do with the fact that I have a really hard time living my life to the fullest extent.  I need to start doing this.
I went to Taylor's funeral today.  I really didn't know him but I felt I should be there.  I don't know why I felt I should've been there.  I feel as if I did something right by being there though.  I don't know...  
I think I'm going crazy.  I have the hardest time relaxing and I can't sit still.
There is a lot of stuff I want to say right now but I don't feel like typing it.  I wish I would though because then maybe I would feel a lot better.

I hate being sick.  I was only able to work 6 hours of my 24 hour shift.  They pretty much told me to go home, which I didn't really have any objection to.  Of course, about 3 hours after I left, they had a stabbing.  Why do I always miss the cool shit?  That would've been my first stabbing.  Maybe next time.  Before that though, we were called to someone is cardiac arrest.  Both of our ambulances and our engine were out.  I was on the ladder, so Jim, my Capitan and I start going and we meet Springfield Township there.  Somehow we both read the street wrong and we ended up in the wrong place.  So while we're in route to the right house, I'm thinking, this person is dead.  It's probably will be 5 minutes until we get there from the time we were dispatched.  Who knows how long the person has been in that situation.  Really, if someone doesn't start working on a person in cardiac arrest within a certain time, I think it's like 6 minutes, they really have no chance of survival.  Anyways, we get there and whoever it was went ahead and called it.  We didn't work on the person or anything, dead on arrival.  Now, this person had been dead for awhile, but I was thinking, just think if this person just went into cardiac arrest.  One wrong turn, because someone couldn't read their pager correctly, killed someone.  All it takes is one stupid mistake.

I've worked 3 shifts so far a Forest Park Fire Department.  I love it.  It is sooo much better than working at Kohl's.  I like the shift that I'm training on so far.  The only thing that bothers me is that I'm not at strong as I would like to be.  This is going to change.  Starting Monday, I'm working out hardcore every third day.  I'm going to be super buff.  I just hope I don't turn out to be gross looking...like big muscles popping out everywhere.

A lot of stuff has gone on within this past week.  Last weekend I attended my first ever scooter rally.  I must say it was a hell of a lot of fun.  All in all there were about two hundred scooters there.  The ride started in Cincinnati, went through Western Hills and Delhi.  We then crossed the Ohio River via the Anderson Ferry, went to Devo Park, through Covington and Newport and ended back in Cincinnati.  It was fun times.  I can't believe that many people were there.  
Monday, Forest Park Fire Department called me and told me they wanted to hire me.  Awesome.  I went up there that day and got fitted for turnout gear and obtained some hand-me-down uniforms.  I also get $250 worth of new uniforms.  I start in one week.  Next Wednesday.  The first ten shifts I work, I will have a mentor and then after those ten shifts I am cut loose to pick up shifts whenever I want.  I'm excited.  
Today, UC called me and told me that I am accepted into their Paramedic program at Raymond Walter's.  I start that in mid-August.  
It seems like everything comes at once.  Craziness.

01) what's yo name? Julie Marie Stanley

02) when is your birthday? 5-7-1985

03) what country would you most like to visit? Japan

04) what do you find most annoying?  pathways being blocked...don't put shit in the middle of a pathway!

05) when's the last time you were in a pillow fight? about two weeks ago...I was sleeping and then all of a sudden, WHAM! the guys at the firehouse bombarded me with pillows...fuckers...

06) what are the last cd's that you bought? a faint cd

07) who's an actor that kicks ass? Vince Vaughn

08) what's the longest relationship you've ever been in? 2 years

09) what do you think about mustard? it's gross

10) are you a good kisser? sometimes

11) ham or cheese? ham is disgusting

12) what do you hate the most? Robots and aliens...seriously.

13) when's the last time you were scared? when I lost my pager and I thought my Capitan was going to kill me...but he didn't :)

14) do you carry a weapon? my arms

15) do you think you'll find true love? maybe

16) rabbit or cactus? angora rabbit

17) what do you eat for breakfast? depends

18) do you believe in saving the whales?  sure

19) would you ever get your ginitals pierced? I think that would really hurt...no

21) who's your favorite rapper? jay z

22) slayer or matchbox 20? slayer fo sho

23) who's hotter, fiona apple or liz phair? I don't think I know what liz phair looks like

24) have you ever made up a nickname for yourself? probably

25) what's your favorite sport?  soccer!!!

26) do you ever listen to barry white? not intentionally

27) if you're attracted to someone do you tell them?  depends who it is

28) have you ever stripped in front of people?  no

29) what's your favorite drink? orange juice

30) do you ever get crunk? sometimes

31) hearts or skulls? <3s

32) do you ever wear pink? all the time

33) what toppings do you put on your ice cream? sprinkles!

34) do you like your life?  sometimes...I think it's getting better than what it used to be

35) weird or wierd?  what? 

36) slacks or trousers? there's a difference?

37) do you ever sing 50 cent songs?  all the time 

38) have you ever talked to a ghost? they aren't real 

39) would you get someone's name tattooed on you? never

40) what's something you regret? i regret nothing

41) hot dog or weiner? hot dogs...

42) are you attracted to people shorter than you? not really

43) have you ever kissed someone with a pierced tongue? no

44) if you got a tattoo today what would it be? a volleyball on my lower back...ha

45) ice cube or ice-t? eh?

46) do you find president bush attractive? not at all

47) what's the color of your favorite underwear?  black  

48) french kiss or french fries? french kiss

49) what's your favorite 80's tv show? fraggle rock

50) would you like to go to the ballet? maybe

60) do you ever look at pornography? haha...all I have to say is Love Chunks

61) city or country? city

62) do you read the newspaper? no

63) are you a beatles fan? somewhat

64) how old do you wish you were? 21, no younger no older

65) do you ever wear mittens? can't say I do

66) do you have a crush on anyone now? my man

67) have you broken a heart or had yours broken?  unfortunately both

68) cupcakes or muffins? cupcakes

69) what do you like most about canada?  what I like aboot canada is that they say eh? a lot

70) who would win in a fight, brazil or china? mos def china

71) what are your thoughts on vegitables? i like them

72) do you ever refer to your arms as guns? haha all the time

73) can white guys dance? not many

74) what would happen on your ideal date? something out of the ordinary

75) banjo or cow bell? cow bell fo sho

I had my first real fire the other night.  I was nervous as hell but it was awesome non-the-less.  It was a car fire and it was up in flames when we got there.  My Capitan rocked and put me on the nozzle so I was the one who put it out.  The only thing that sucked about the whole situation was that when I was attempting to exit the truck, I tripped, fell, and landed on my ass.  Luckily I got up before my Capitan saw me.
I've come to the conclusion that I really have no passion in life.  It's very depressing.  I need to find a hobby, stat.

Last night while working at Kohl's, I was called to the domestics registers.  Of course I was very annoyed considering I thought another stupid customer needed help or worse, they were going to make me run a register even though it was not my turn.  Much to my surprise, a security guard from the mall was having an all out seizure.  Now I have never seen a seizure before.  It was quite frightening because I didn't know what to expect.  His whole body turned bright purple from lack of oxygen and my other co-worker and I thought that he had stopped breathing.  I went to go get a pocket face mask to do CPR but luckily he started getting some color back in his face when I came back.  He must have seized for at least 4 minutes but it felt like 10.  I'm just happy that I knew what to do.  I just put him on his side so that he wouldn't choke on his drool or tongue.  That's really all I could do.  A lot of times I feel helpless in these situations.  I really can't do anything for most people.  Either I don't have any equipment to do anything for them or I can't give them the drugs they need.  By the time the paramedics came he had stopped seizing and was somewhat coherent.  He couldn't follow simple directions and seemed scared and confused.  Which from what I understand in normal.  He should be fine though.  Either way it was quite and experience.  What sucks though, is that sometimes it seems like I have more "runs" at Kohl's than I do at Little Miami.  
I have my interview with Forest Park today.  They had a 5 alarm fire yesterday.

50 things you may not know about me...

1.  My biggest pet peeve is when someone puts something/anything, in a pathway and blocks the pathway.  
2.  I have a thing for watches.
3.  No one remotely close to me has died.  
4.  I am deathly afraid of robots and aliens.
5.  I really don't want to be a firefighter.
6.  I wrecked my car a week after I got it, causing about $600 in damage to my vehicle.
7.  I have been to over half of the U.S. states.  
8.  I rarely watch t.v.
9.  Sometimes I hate having a boyfriend because then I seem to ruin my friendships.
10. I don't like riding on boats.
11. I have seen someone die right in front of me.
12. I have never broken a bone.
13. I hate cats, especially Angela's.  
14. It is impossible for me to get a tan.  I go from red, back to transparent.
15. The only time I have gotten into a fist fight is with my brother when I was younger.
16. My mom threatened to call the cops on me because I almost broke his jaw.
17. I am afraid of death.
18. I feel like a stalker sometimes because I read people's live journals and know their whole life story even though I've never met them.
19. My favorite color is hot pink.
20. I have a problem with fat people complaining they are fat.  They could be working out instead of complaining.
21. I don't like working with girls.
22. The only thing I can cook are desserts and ramen noodles.
23. Salvador Dali is my favorite painter.
24. I am conversant in Spanish.
25. I am not a very worldly person.
26. I could eat chinese food everyday.
27. I hated the movie Napoleon Dynamite.
28. Reality t.v. is stupid yet I can't stop watching it.
29. I am in love with Doctor Phil.
30. The only thing I have stolen is a huge, orange pilates ball from a yard that backed up to Princeton Rd.  Angela was an accomplice.
31. I tried to drive my van into a parking garage that wasn't high enough for my van.
32. I hate than cold weather more than anything, ever.
33. I am lame and won't stay out late if I have to wake up early the next morning.
34. I used to photograph local bands.
35. Normally, I won't talk very much when I first meet someone.
36. I am not very fond of shopping.
37. People say I'm very mature for my age.
38. I secretly wouldn't mind being a cheerleader.
39. I have things that I haven't told anyone. 
40. I will pretend to like people even if I don't.
41. I hate being a girl.
42. I like attention.
43. Working with other people is a challenge for me.
44. I think I know most everything.
45. I hate driving.
46. I've never gone to church.
47. Sometimes I think I'm dyslexic.
48. I can't stand listening to the radio.
49. The only thing I drink is water and occasionally orange juice.
50. I think I'm better than most people.

I was sitting in my room tonight and I get a phone call on my cell phone.  I was confused because it said that my house was calling me.  So I answered and it was my mom.  She called me from her room.  Now I don't have a big house.  She was too fucking lazy to walk 20 ft to my room to tell me something so she fucking called me.  I fucking hate lazy people.

Mexico was awesome.  I wish I was there still.  
Somehow I managed to pass Forest Park's agility test.  My only goal was to complete it without dying and not only did I do that, I was able to finish it in the time allotted.  I also passed the written test.  Next step in the process in an interview.  That will be cake.  
From what I understand, the last time this test was given for this department, 15 girls took the test.  None of them passed.  I believe I am the first girl to pass the test there.  The girls that work there now didn't have to take that same test when they were hired.  From what I heard, it was much easier.  For this group of people I was the only girl to take the test and the only girl that passed.  I hope I get hired.  Everyone seems to think I will.  Unfortunately, I think I will still have to stay at Kohl's a couple days a week because of health insurance.  I am seriously going to look into getting health insurance outside of it though.
I really miss playing soccer.  I was hoping to get a team together but I only know one other person that even plays.  Well at least one other person that I could actually get a hold of.  
I found out my Uncle has cancer.  I really don't find myself upset about this.  All the advances in technology and all the people who survive cancer make me not worry.  But when I talk to him I just want to cry.  I hope he will be ok.  
....................
I've never been more nervous than I am right now.  ajsldjfaljglkj

Finally...we had a run.  Of course it had to be at 3 a.m. but I will take what I can get.  The call came in as a possible stroke and then as we went in route, dispatch said that the person wasn't breathing and that CPR was being administered.  And then I thought, damn, this is the real thing again.  I might be seeing someone take their last breath tonight.  When we arrived at the residence, CPR wasn't being administered and the patient was breathing.  I was surprised that I wasn't more nervous.  I still feel helpless in these runs but I do what I know to do.  That's all I can do.  I didn't have to transport the patient rather go back to the fire house and sleep.  It was kind of nice but I still wouldn't have minded transporting.  Apparently the patient had a seizure once they got to the hospital.  I've never seen a seizure.  I think it would kind of freak me out.  Now that I think about it...I'm surprised I chose this profession because I think a lot of stuff would freak me out.
Today I got my results back from the City of Hamilton.  136 people took the test.  106 passed it.  I rank 38.  Considering this was my first civil service test ever, I'm very happy with my score.  I guess I still have an outside chance to take the agility test.  I hope they find a lot of people below me that have DUIs and criminal histories so that I rank higher.  
Tomorrow is Forest Park's test.  I think I'm kicking ass for my size, considering we have to wear a 50 lb vest and 10 lbs heavier that would be half of my body weight.  I'm almost positive that I'm not going to finish in time.  I'm going to do my best though.

The last three times I have worked at the fire house, I have had no runs.  While it is nice getting paid to eat pizza, watch t.v., and sleep, I would like to get some action.  Now, I'm don't want people to get hurt or their houses to burn down or anything, but let's face it, these kind of things happen.  But come on...why can't something happen in my district?  
Forest Park's test is Saturday.  It is going to suck.
Four more days and I will be in Mexico.  :)
I hope to update this more often.

I'm proud of myself.  I woke my ass up at 6:30 this morning to work out and succeeded.  I am very worried about this Forest Park agility test.  I know I have the strength to do it but I am worried about the time limit.  Numerous things have to be completed within 8 minutes and 20 seconds.  I think I will be ok but I have failed a couple of agility tests in the past and I've very nervous about failing yet another one.  Of course I didn't have the strength then that I do now.  Jim will kick my ass if I fail this test and so will I.  That is why I am going to pass it.

13 more days I will be in Mexico.  :)
Wait, they don't love you like I love you...
I HATE this weather.  I cannot wait to go to Mexico and get away from this crap!  16 more days I think!

Last week at LMFR I transported my first patient...By myself.  I guess my capitan didn't see it necessary to put someone with me the first time I go to the hospital.    I was convinced she was going to code on me since she was an old lady.  Luckily she didn't.  
Bryan and I saw an Irish band play last night.  He's into all that stuff.  They had some bag pipe players come in wearing their outfits.  It was pretty sweet.
Forest Park's agility test is the 12th.  I'm going to kick it's ass and get a real part-time job.

I took the civil service test for the full time firefighter's position for the city of Hamilton today.  I'm pretty confident that I did well on the test.  I was only unsure about 2 answers.  Unfortunately, I think most of the 150+ people that were there to take the test, thought they did pretty well too.  I can't believe that many people were there.  I don't know.  We'll see what happens.  The more I think about it, the more I really want that job.  
Work went by pretty fast.  After-wards I went to Rick's Tavern to meet up with Feryal and some other people from work.  I wasn't aware that it was 21+.  So I couldn't stay.  I did however get to see Clayton tonight.  I'm happy I got to see him.  I hope we get to hang out more often.

I listened to Half the Battle today.  
And it was awesome.
I want a Half the Battle reunion.

So apparently I'm not taking the Spanish class for Medical Personnel.  When I went up to Butler Tech tonight to start the class, I was informed that it was canceled.  This is crap.  Last time I tried to take this class it was canceled too.  Crap.  
Now I kind of feel bad for calling off work today.  I guess it wasn't the smartest thing to do because I need money.  But then again it was nice having a day off.  
I have also come to the conclusion that having a boyfriend right now sucks.  I don't get to see him nearly as much as I would like to.  And when I do see him I don't want to go out.  I'm sure that's very frustrating for him.  And it also seems all I do is complain about money or that I'm tired or stressed.  I hate that things always seem to come at the wrong times.  I hope I can keep sucking it up because I really hate being stressed out and taking it out on other people.

I worked my first 24 hour shift ever yesterday/lastnight.  I like working 24 hour shifts.  I learned more yesterday than I did in the past two shifts put together.  My Captain also took me over to see the other station.  It's not as nice as ours.  I'm happy I don't work over at that one.  The people seem weird and very hyper.  For some reason whenever that station gets a fire call our station also has to accompany them.  Yesterday I was on the Engine and they had an alarm drop.  So we had to go.  Since I was on the engine I had to ride it over there.  That was the first time that I rode the on the fire truck.  It was pretty exciting.  I had some of my gear on and I felt official.  For some reason that call made me less nervous about being on the fire truck.  Of course we were disregarded before we even made it over there but it was awesome riding in the truck.  Last night was the first night I slept in the bunk room with everyone else and despite what I thought, it wasn't bad at all.  I slept really well and no one snored.  It was nice.  This morning I came home and took a nap before work.  I woke up and called off.  So then I proceed to go back to sleep and slept until about 2.  I can't stand working at Kohl's anymore.  I really need to find a new job.  Like now.  I don't care if it's a fire job or not.  I think at this point I will work anywhere but Kohl's.  Tonight I start a Spanish class for medical personnel.  I'm quite excited about this.  I hope it is worth my time.
I also have a huge headache.  I hate it.
I have finally watched Napoleon Dynamite and I must say a was very dissapointed in it.  I'm going to say it sucked.

Today I have successfully completed working 60 hours in 6 days.  Hopefully this will never happen again because I am super tired and grouchy.  Everyone that has pissed me off or tired to argue with me today has definitely gotten bitched out.  I don't take shit anymore.  That is what lack of sleep and stress from stupid ass retail jobs does to you.  It makes you not be able to tolerate anything and you end up yelling at people you would have had no intentions of yelling at before.  I have come to the conclusion that working at Kohl's has made me a mean person.  I hope this does not continue with future jobs.  
Yesterday I worked at LMFR.  There was no excitement at all.  We ate dinner, did chores and headed off to bed.  I slept like crap.  
I have also come to the conclusion that I am lame.  I really have no desire to go out and party tonight.  I can't decide if this is from lack of sleep or that I just suck.  Either way I will probably be asleep by 10:30.  
I hope everyone chooses to be safe tonight.

I have managed to survive my first shift ever as a Firefighter/EMT.  There were four other people that I was working with.  They were all pretty nice.  I'm a little nervous about the Captain though.  One of the guys was saying that sometimes he's not very clear on what he wants and sometimes no one really knows where they're at until the call comes in.  I was in the position last night where whatever type of call came in, I would be on that apparatus.  We had two calls.  One was a lifting assistance call and the other was a diabetic emergency.  So I only rode on the ambulance which was fine with me.  Despite what I thought I slept like a baby.  So at 1:30 A.M. when our pagers went off, the bells rang, and the lights came on it scared the hell out of me.  I was sleeping good too, but I guess I should expect that from now on.  During that call I was listening to the radio and noticed that Forest Park was having a big ass fire.  Then it hit me and kind of freaked me out that I could have a huge fire as well.  Luckily we didn't but I realized that this is the real thing now.  I'm where I want to be.  It's exciting but very very scary too.
I came home this morning and had Christmas with my family.  It was nice.  My dad made me a mix cd.  Even though I received other gifts I think this is my favorite one.   
Tomorrow I get to see Bryan and we are exchanging gifts.  :)

This snow fucking sucks...there is too much of it.  My subdivision has not been plowed yet.  None the less we attempted to go to the grocery store.  We didn't even make it onto the street and my mom managed to get my car stuck in our drive way.

So I was working in the shoe department yesterday and who do I see trying on shoes.   Why it was Miss Katy Reno.  I haven't seen her since we got out of high school.  She is home on break from Spain right now.  We are supposed to hang out before she goes back.  It would be really nice to see her again.  
Oh wait...there's more.  About five minutes later after Katy and I parted ways, who else do I see come strolling down the isle?  None other than Chris Campbell himself.  He is on leave from the army right now.  I can tell he has matured very much from selling his soul to the government.  It was nice seeing him too.   
Right now I have the biggest headache ever.  I do believe it's from dealing with all the stupid ass customers at work.  I can't wait for the Christmas season to be over with.  
On a better note, I received a pager from Little Miami Fire Department.  I can now see what the calls are.  I start Friday night.  YAY!

Last night I graduated my recruit class for Little Miami Fire and Rescue.  I must say I feel completely unprepared.  I really didn't learn anything other than how to report discrimination or sexual harassment.  I guess overall I am thankful for the classes we had.  Looking back on it, the classes did answer many questions.  But still I feel very unprepared. I don't think it helps either that my first shift is Christmas Eve from 6p.m. to 6a.m.  I honestly doubt anyone is going to show me what needs to be done and my daily duties as a firefighter on Christmas Eve.  I'm pretty sure everyone is going to be in holiday mode and isn't going to want to deal with me.  We'll see though.  Even though this whole situation is nerve racking, I am quite excited.  I hope everything goes somewhat ok.  
I also got a kick ass badge which I am quite excited about.

This past week was definitely the worst and best week all in one.  I saw the messengers play in Indy.  I sold merchandise for them too and made $5 on a tip.  It was pretty sweet.  I must say I totally don't fit in with that crowd.  Everyone was all punk rocked out and had mohawks.  I'm definitely not punk rock and obviously don't have a mohawk.  It was fun non the less.
I was watching the Adam's Family Values tonight and I've come to the conclusion that it is one of the best movies ever made.  It's quick and to the point.  It captures your attention and is just a well made movie.  It's depressing that many movies just suck these days.  More movies need to be like the Adam's Family.
I tried to get recruited to a church today while at work.  I should've told the lady I worship the devil and I am not interested.  
Tonight is one of the first nights in awhile that I have relaxed.  I miss it.

So I have started training at Little Miami Fire Department.  So far we've gone over rules and have gotten our uniforms.  I must say, I make being an EMT/Firefighter look good.  It's kind of nice because some people respect me already since Bryan has talked about me a lot and Tom knows I know my shit.  But something has already pissed me off.  The Lt. in charge of training said to Bryan, "It's hard to believe that your girlfriend could pull that 145lb dummy 100ft."  Basically he was implying that I got this job only because I knew Bryan and he pulled some strings and I'm his girlfriend.  Luckily, the people that I took the test in front of were there and said no, Julie is a fucking badass.  She fucked that dummy up.  And yes, yes I did fuck that dummy up hardcore.  I mean really, why the fuck would you say something like that when it's the first time you've ever seen me.  He hasn't seen me preform anything.  So fuck him.  He's already made enemies with me.
Anyways, I really think I'm losing it.  So far, I thought I lost my phone when it was in my purse the whole time.  I didn't even look in there before I searched everywhere for it.  Also, the other day I was attempting to get some gas and the nozzle would not fit in the gas tank to save my life.  Thank god the nozzles are bigger on the diesel pumps and it would not fit into my gas tank because yes, I tried to put diesel fuel in my car.
I have obtained a copy of the Ren and Stimpy show...I am quite excited about this.

I can't relax.  This weekend is going to be crazy.  Tomorrow, work and then drag show.  Saturday, work and halloween party.  I can't decide if I want to be a sumo wrestler or a devil.  Sunday, work and hopefully Bryan will be home.  If I didn't have to work all this would be ok.  I've come to the conclusion that I get stressed out to easily.  This is going to stop.
Note:  My cd is coming along nicely.

I am going to make the greatest cd ever.
Unless Feryal can find a babysitter, she will not be attending the drag show.
Nancy and Mike might go, but that will be it from work.  
I hope some of Angela's peeps go, otherwise we are going to look like lesbians.
Tomorrow I've decided that my sickness will be gone.  
My cd is really going to be awesome.

I am losing my voice.  This sucks.  I can't decide if I am sick or not.  My throat feels like it is closing but it doesn't hurt.  It makes it hard to sleep when I can't breathe very well.  And it sucks I couldn't hang out with Mike yesterday and see his super cool zombie costume because I suck and had to be sick.  
Yesterday I carved a pumpkin.  It was fun.  I listened to the Clash as well.  Bryan made me a CD with a bunch of punk rawk stuff on it.  Most of it I am enjoying.  A lot of it sounds the same though.  I miss him.  One more week.  I'm suprised he has called me everyday.  I like it.  I've never been in a relationship where the guy is super sweet and all that other good stuff.  I think I'll keep him.  :)
Today I bought the hottest shoes ever.  They are hot pink addidas with white stripes.  I am in love with them.  And I also got to hang out with the most awesome person ever...Angela.
For the first time in a long time, I feel happy.

Everyone that told me to get a livejournal doesn't use their livejournal to the extent they used to.  Thus, leaving this thing to be boring.  Angela and Rob!  get back with the program!
Yesterday sucked.  All I did was pick up after people in shoes.  It was bullshit.
Today was good though.  I went to Bryan's.  He stole me some yummy oatmeal rasin cookies from his work.  They were excellent.  Then, he his roommates and I proceeded to cruise around on scooters.  It was fun times, except when there was going down big hills or turning involved.  I must get a scooter.  They are so fun!  Bryan said he would teach me to drive his.  It is going to rock.  
Then I came home, ate dinner and watched Saved!  Unfortuantely it wasn't as good as I thought it would be, but not bad non-the-less.
I have the biggest headache ever.

So I thought I was on vacation next week but apparently I'm not?  Actually, I was supposed to be on vacation this week.  My manager didn't schedule it.  So I'm working all week.  Fuck him.
I guess it's good though because maybe I'll realize that it's going to suck if I don't schedule it when some other people aren't too busy.  Otherwise I will be by myself with nothing to do.  
Tomorrow is Death Cab.  It should be fun.  Except for the fact that I have to be at work all day before hand.  6 A.M. is too early to be working.  I really need to get out of Kohl's.  Like now.

Joe called me to try and round up some boxes for him.  He moves out Friday.  I'm happy for him because he really needs to get out of his parent's house.  
Hung out with Bryan today.  We went to Jungle Jim's.  That place is insane.  It has changed so much it's ridiculous.  He saw this crazy German cake though and he said he had one at home.  He is going to bake one for me.  He rocks.
I have to go back to work tomorrow at 6 A.M.  I'm not looking forward to it at all.  But next week I am on vacation.  I hope I start training at Little Miami because something tells me I won't be going to Cleveland.  That really pisses me off.

Bryan took my for a ride on his scooter and now I want one.  It will be awhile but I am going to buy a hot pink one.  It is going to rock.  
I wanted to paint today.  I went to hobby lobby to get some canvas but they were closed.  That ruined my day.  
This whole day was one big uneventful waste of a day.

I've completely fucked up my back.  I'm not exactly sure how but I do know dragging that dummy didn't help.  I've called off two days of work because of it.  Usually I am a very active person and aren't home very often.  Just laying down for these past two days have killed me.  I need to go out and do something.  I am bored out of my mind.  
I wish I could start at Little Miami like now.  I'm tired of waiting.  Waiting sucks.
And what the fuck is up with Chris?  I don't understand at all.  And neither does Pfeff.  All my fire school boys have lost it, completely.  I don't think I'm too far behind either.
I really want some good fucking music to listen to right now too.  SoulSeek fucking sucks.  I can never get anything.  Fuck.Fuck.Fuck.

I would just like to re-iterate that I am a badass.  I busted my ass today and fucked that agility test up.  I passed all my practicals and the written EMS test.  I also had a little interview with Assistant Chief Ramsey.  That went well.  I didn't expect an interview but hey I was ready for it.  At the end he said that we are most likely going to hire you and you can decide now or later if you're interested in this position.  I said yes.  I really don't care if I get the job or not, I'm just so happy with myself that I passed the agility test.  Bryan was my proctor for my practicals and I liked that.  He rocks.  In a few weeks I will go though their training program to learn their way of doing things and to learn how to drive the ambulance.  The only downside with this is that it took me an hour to get to the station.  I think rush hour traffic had to do with it but still...it sucks.  I'll take what I can get though.  Bryan also said that I did better than everyone else that took the tests and that Ramsey was very impressed with me.  :)
My back is killing me.  No more lifting for me for awhile.

So, my uncle left the hospital today.  He's doing much better.  I am happy about this.
I have decided that I am going to kick this agility test's ass tomorrow.  I'm going to give it all I got and more.  I think I am more worried about the practicals than the actual agility test.  It's been forever since I've done assessments or intubated something.  I think I'll be ok though.  
I went to Jacob's and I saw this older cop from my EMT class.  He really is the last person I expected to be there.  I'm still having trouble coping with this.  
I've also come the the conclusion that life is too short to be boring and not go out and have fun.  I'm going to make it a point to include more fun in my life.

I don't feel like writing in this thing anymore.  I can't say what I truely want to for fear of creating a bunch of stupid drama.  My uncle is having triple by-pass surgery tomorrow and I feel so bad for him.  He's one of the few family members that I love being around.
My uncle had a heart attack this morning.  :'(
